member.name: M:Unigine.Navigation.getNavigation(int)
member.summary: Returns the specified connected navigation area.

member.name: M:Unigine.Navigation.inside(Unigine.Ptr{Navigation})
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the specified Navigation area is a part of the Navigation area.

member.name: M:Unigine.Navigation.inside2D(Unigine.Math.Vec3,float)
member.summary: Depending on the type of the navigation area, the function performs the following: For navigation sectors, it checks whether the given point is inside the navigation sector. The height of the navigation sector (Z coordinate) is ignored. For navigation meshes, it checks whether the given point is inside the navigation mesh and the distance from the point to the mesh is in range [-height;height]. Here height is a height of the navigation mesh.
member.param: The radius of the point. The radius is used to exclude exceeding the navigation mesh by the point.If the radius is set, it is more likely that the point will be inside the navigation mesh.When calling the function for NavigationSector, this option is irrelevant.
member.returns: 1 if the point is inside the navigation area; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Navigation.inside3D(Unigine.Math.Vec3,float)
member.summary: Depending on the type of the navigation area, the function performs the following: For navigation sectors, it checks whether the given point is inside the navigation area. Notice that the height of the navigation sector (Z coordinate) is also taken into account. For navigation meshes, it checks whether the given point is inside the navigation mesh and the distance from the point to the mesh is in range [0;height]. Here height is a height of the navigation mesh.
member.param: The radius of the point. The radius is used to exclude exceeding the navigation mesh by the point.If the radius is set, it is more likely that the point will be inside the navigation mesh.When calling the function for NavigationSector, this option is irrelevant.
member.returns: 1 it the point is inside the navigation area; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationMesh.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Creates an empty navigation mesh.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationMesh.#ctor(char)
member.summary: Creates a navigation mesh from the given *.mesh file.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationMesh.setMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh})
member.summary: Copies a given mesh into the mesh, on which the current navigation mesh is based.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is copied successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationMesh.getMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh})
member.summary: Copies the mesh that is used as a base for the current navigation mesh into the received mesh. A mesh used as a base for the navigation mesh should meet the requirements described here.
member.param: A mesh into which the current mesh is copied.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is copied successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationMesh.setMeshPath(char,int)
member.summary: Sets a new path for the mesh used as a base for the navigation mesh and forces loading of the mesh with the new path for the current navigation mesh.
member.param: Path to the *.mesh-file to be set.
Force flag.If 1 is specified, the mesh with the new path will be loaded immediately.If 0 is specified, only the mesh path will be updated.
member.returns: true if:The current mesh path coincides the new path.The mesh with the new path has been loaded successfully.The force flag is set to 0. In other cases,false.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationMesh.loadMesh(char)
member.summary: Loads a mesh, on which the navigation mesh is based, from the file. This function doesn't change the mesh name.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is loaded successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationMesh.saveMesh(char)
member.summary: Saves the mesh, on which the navigation mesh is based, to the file.
member.param: A relative path to the *.mesh file.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is saved successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationMesh.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationSector.#ctor(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a navigation sector of the specified size.

member.name: M:Unigine.NavigationSector.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObstacleBox.#ctor(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new cuboid-shaped obstacle of a specified size.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObstacleBox.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObstacleCapsule.#ctor(float,float)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new capsule-shaped obstacle of a specified size.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObstacleCapsule.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObstacleSphere.#ctor(float)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new sphere-shaped obstacle of a specified size.

member.name: M:Unigine.ObstacleSphere.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.#ctor(float)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new 2D or 3D route. The radius is used to check whether the point can move inside a navigation area or this navigation area should be excluded from pathfinding.
member.param: Radius of the point moving along the route.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.setExcludeNavigations(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Sets the list of navigation sectors and navigation meshes to be ignored during pathfinding.
member.param: Array of the ignored navigation areas.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.getExcludeNavigations
member.summary: Returns the list of navigation sectors and navigation meshes excluded from pathfinding.
member.param: Array to store the excluded navigation areas.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.setExcludeObstacles(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Sets the list of obstacles to be ignored during pathfinding.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.getExcludeObstacles
member.summary: Returns the list of obstacles ignored during pathfinding.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.getIntersection(Unigine.Ptr{PathRouteIntersection})
member.summary: Returns the first intersected obstacle.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.getNavigation(int)
member.summary: Returns the navigation sector or mesh within which the specified route point is located.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.getObstacle(int)
member.summary: Returns the obstacle around which the route is turning.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.getPoint(int)
member.summary: Returns the coordinates of the turning point in the route.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.addExcludeNavigation(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Sets a navigation sector or a navigation mesh to be ignored during pathfinding. Excluded sectors/meshes are added into the list.
member.param: A navigation area to be ignored.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.addExcludeObstacle(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Sets an obstacle to be ignored during pathfinding. Excluded obstacles are added into the list.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.create2D(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int)
member.summary: Calculates a 2D route between the given points with the specified delay.
member.param: The number of frames which is possible to delay pathfinding calculations. 0 means the pathfinding should be calculated immediately.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.create3D(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int)
member.summary: Calculates a 3D route between the given points with the specified delay.
member.param: The number of frames which is possible to delay pathfinding calculations. 0 means the pathfinding should be calculated immediately.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.removeExcludeNavigation(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Removes a navigation sector or a navigation mesh from the list of ignored ones during pathfinding.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.removeExcludeObstacle(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
member.summary: Removes an obstacle from the list of ignored ones during pathfinding.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRoute.renderVisualizer(Unigine.Math.vec4)
member.summary: Renders the route in a given color. You should enable the engine visualizer by the show_visualizer 1 console command.

member.name: M:Unigine.PathRouteIntersection.#ctor
member.summary: The PathRouteIntersection constructor.
